comments.author: florian.haenel@heeen.de
comments.text:
Created attachment 558498
draw log of me entering some letters, texture images and update regions

I want to use a display port on fennec's #controls-scrollbox, which is the scrollbox that contains both the sidebars as well as the url bar. However, when I set the display port, you enter the awesomebar and enter some text, the #popup-autocomplete turns up and seems to prevent any updates to the text edit.

If you enter enough text into the url bar to fill it, it gets suddenly gets visible all at once.

If you don't enter anything, the popup doesn't show and you can see the caret.
comments.creator: florian.haenel@heeen.de

Hmm, last I was familiar with the displayport code, it only worked for out-of-process HTML ViewportFrames.  Has it been generalized since then?  Cool.

Would a rectangular displayport set on the controls box include the content area?  (<browser remote>).  That's going to waste some memory, but might be OK.

My guess is that forcing the XUL element into its own layer is somehow exposing a z-ordering bug that wasn't obvious before.  I would check that all the elements are ordered correctly.
